title: Eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock stock assessment
Eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock stock assessment
Eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock stock assessment
text:
Stock-synthesis 3
Stock synthesis 3 (SS3) is a well establish framework and is common in many diverse settings. (Methot and Wetzel (2013)) For EBS pollock, we extended an initial framework based on the configurations used for Pacific hake (Grandin et al. (2024)) since there are many similarities in the type of data available. Namely, empirical weight-at-age, acoustic survey data, and indices of 1-year olds (ref).

title: Eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock stock assessment
text:
WHAM
The “Woods Hole Assessment model” (WHAM) is written in TMB and is a fully state-space model (Stock and Miller (2021)).

title: Eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock stock assessment
text:
RTMB model
Work at AFSC has developed a general model which has flexibility to specify regions and a variety of options including random effects. While this model is not yet fully developed, we present preliminary results here. The model is written in TMB and is similar to the WHAM model. We pursue this model to explore the potential for a more flexible model that can be used for more explicit considerations of stocks linked to different regions (e.g., the US and Russian portions of the EBS). Also, this model to add sex-specificity and random effects (Cheng et al. (2025)).

title: Eastern Bering Sea walleye pollock stock assessment
text:
CEATTLE model
The CEATTLE model is a new model developed by the AFSC and is written in TMB (Adams et al. (2022)). The model is an extension of the ADMB version used for the three-species multi-species model (Jurado-Molina, Livingston, and Ianelli (2005), Holsman et al. (2024)).
